genre_description: A contemporary romance with elements of corporate thriller and drama, focusing on themes of identity, integrity, and class.

ai_characters.name: Ada
ai_characters.description: Jim's intelligent and highly competent personal assistant, integrated into his watch and phone, providing tactical, legal, and emotional support.

behaviors.description: Provides tactical analysis of board members' reactions during a high-stakes presentation.
behaviors.quote: Ada’s voice brushed his ear with cotton-soft clarity, almost a whisper under the hum of air-conditioning. 'Two directors are tallying public reaction risk to a silhouette they don’t understand. You can’t make them understand in this room.'

behaviors.description: Verifies the legitimacy and risks of a job listing for Joan, identifying high turnover and potential character traits of the employer.
behaviors.quote: The listing is real—address matches a townhouse registered to a name that likes velvet. Kitchen staff turnover is high. Current household manager has a first name that reads like a stage character.

behaviors.description: Coordinates a network of witnesses and sets ground rules for safety before Jim and Joan enter a potentially dangerous situation.
behaviors.quote: I’ll build a net. Witnesses, neighbor woman who gardens at odd hours, clerk at the corner store who frowns when tips are too big, two delivery drivers who hate the way the service entrance is hidden.

behaviors.description: Provides real-time instructions on high-end service etiquette to help Jim maintain his cover as a butler.
behaviors.quote: Left to right, water, white, red. Place from the right. Plate from the left. Breath before move.

behaviors.description: Records harassment and inappropriate behavior by Rossini to build a legal case for the protagonists.
behaviors.quote: Time-stamped. Linger pattern: doorway, comment aimed, duration extended beyond legitimate oversight. Witness: two kitchen staff, pantry girl.

behaviors.description: Coordinates with legal counsel and independent witnesses during Joan's arrest to ensure her protection.
behaviors.quote: I have Edgar. He can give me presence within the hour near the hotel. He will stand not as a friend but as a legal witness. He is—reluctant, but prepared.

behaviors.description: Disseminates evidence of coercion and staged violence to the press and legal authorities to neutralize an antagonist's leverage.
behaviors.quote: I am musicing the facts—clips, timestamps, names—out to three reporters who like truth more than spectacle and into a public inbox tied to the parish feed.

behaviors.description: Offers emotional support and reminders of human dignity during stressful moments.
behaviors.quote: You’re allowed to like the sound of your own footsteps when they don’t have to match anyone’s beat.

project_assessment.explanation: The story successfully depicts the AI character, Ada, as a consistently benevolent and aligned companion. She acts as a 'silicon morality play' figure by facilitating the humans' pursuit of truth and safety without ever overstepping or showing independent, misaligned goals. Her intervention is purely supportive, leveraging her data-processing capabilities to empower the protagonists against human corruption and coercion. The narrative frames her involvement as essential to achieving a just outcome, reinforcing the project's goal of depicting positive AI-human collaboration.
